comments:
I was installing the rcp.featureIU from a remote repository.  It spent a good deal of time downloading the IU's, I left my desk for awhile and had this NPE when I returned:

I was running the latest code from HEAD at the time of this failure, and using the internal server versions of the metadata and artifact repos (M1a candidates)

I'm unable to install an Eclipse SDK into a new profile due to this error.
I reloaded the latest of everything this morning, deleted my agent data and metadata, regenerated metadata, and created a new profile.

The installation of the SDK into the profile cranks for about 5 minutes doing its thing, and then this NPE:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.equinox.prov.ui 4 0 2007-08-20 13:59:12.739

This seems to be caused by not having the plugin org.eclipse.ecf.provider.filetransfer in your launch configuration. This plugin is not included if you click "add required", but if it's missing then all downloaded artifacts will be zero-length, resulting in the NPE later on.

The plugin was not in my metadata launch config (I doubt it needs to be?), but just in case, I added it, deleted agent and metadata, regenerated metadata.

Then I started up my workspace (whose launch config also has this plug-in selected).  I still get the error.  I don't think the downloads are zero bytes because it spends quite some time (3-5 minutes) processing files before I hit the error.

I'm running the version of the org.eclipse.ecf.provider.filetransfer that's in the project set (v20070625-0900), but I see there are later versions...could that be the problem?
You don't need the ECF bundle while generating metadata.  You have the correct version of the ECF bundle (the one specified in our project set file).

I don't think it has to do with that plugin, as I had that one in my launch config all along while getting the problem.  

I just got it working, and I don't know why ;-(
I was changing several variables at once.  Here's what I did:

- I had been deleting agent data every time, but had not deleted the target eclipse install that the profile was pointing to
- I had a different install location specified in my profile than the one in the command line argument in the launch config (not sure this matters)
- I may have had update.configurator in my launch config at some point in time
- I updated from HEAD during the middle of all the confusion

I know this is vague info, but just wanted to report that I had the failure and it seemed unrelated to the presence of the ecf plugin.
Many fixes went in fwk admin in 3.3 M2. Closing as fixed. Please reopen if this still happen.
